newsitem.title: USA: CBT shrs rise after Q4 beats forecast.
newsitem.headline: CBT shrs rise after Q4 beats forecast.

text.p: Shares of CBT Group Plc, a software provider to businesses, rose 4-1/8 to 65-1/8 after a fourth quarter earnings report that beat analysts' forecasts.
CBT reported fourth quarter net income of $0.26 a share on revenues of $21.7 million, which is double the $0.13 a share on revenues of $13.5 million one year ago.
Analysts had expected CBT to earn $0.23 a share in the fourth quarter ended December 31, according to First Call.
"CBT continued to experience solid growth through signing new contracts, deepening penetration of the exisiting customer base, William McCabe, chairman, said in a statement.
CBT said it grew its backlog to $60.3 million at December 31 from $27.1 million a year earlier.
The company now has 328 interactive educational software titles in its library, a 99 percent increase over a year ago.
In the year ahead, the company said it will continue to focus on telesales of its products targeted to small- and mid-sized organizations. It will also focus on educational and governmental markets.
The company also said it would build its base of Internet-related software titles.
